Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2013 06:43AM Asaram123 wrote: I had a mastectomy in April of 2009, completed my chemotherapy and radiation at the end of 2010.  Since I was active duty at that time, i didn't go to a series of counseling for breast cancer survivor forum because I was scared and not prepared for a lot of reasons.  I was in denial at that time, telling my medical providers when I go for follow-up treatment that I was doing fine.  I retired in August 2011, and was still telling my doctors that I was fine and feeling good about myself, after a breast and reconstruction/ implant surgery.  When I filed for VA claim, one of the nurses interrogated me if how did I feel about my surgery and I said, fine!  I was afraid to tell her or the physician that I was experiencing a lot of stress and anger and it was also affecting my marital life.  I didn't want to tell them I was depressed and anxious on a lot of stuff in my everyday life because I was thinking that it could affect my chances to land a job after retiring from the military.  Is this a systom of PTSD?
Posts.Title: PTSD and Mastectomy vs Lumpectomy farmerlucy farmerlucy
